text: are you feeling exhausted and drained
lately even though you can't pinpoint
why it's not uncommon to develop habits
that sap your energy without realizing
it these habits can gradually wear you
down leaving you fatigued and depleted
but don't worry there are things you can
do to identify and address these energy
draining habits by making small changes
to your daily routine and becoming more
aware of your habits you can start to
improve your energy levels and overall
well-being in this video we'll discuss
some of the most common habits that
might be causing your energy drain and
offer some practical and compassionate
suggestions for how to address them
couch potato
did you know that sitting for extended
periods can have negative impacts on
your physical health which can
ultimately affect your mental health and
energy levels according to Dr Kelly
McGonagall a health psychologist and
lecturer at Stanford University sitting
for long periods is associated with
negative outcomes such as obesity heart
disease and even depression and can also
lead to poor posture tight muscles and
reduce blood flow which can cause
fatigue and decreased energy levels to
counteract the negative effects of
prolonged sitting taking regular breaks
and moving around is crucial even small
amounts of activity like standing
stretching or walking can help increase
alertness improve blood flow and reduce
stiffness according to research
incorporating physical activity from
walking to yoga or hitting the gym into
your daily routine can also help offset
the harmful effects of sitting and can
improve both physical and mental health
leading to increased energy levels and
improved well-being overthinking
you ever find yourself constantly
replaying situations in your head and
over analyzing every detail
it's a habit that many of us fall into
that can leave us feeling mentally
drained and emotionally exhausted Dr
Susan Nolan hoaxima a leading psychology
expert and author of women who think too
much notes that overthinking can lead to
negative outcomes such as increased
stress anxiety and even depression when
you overthink it can consume your mental
energy and leave you feeling depleted
breaking this habit can be challenging
but there are techniques that can help
mindful practices such as deep breathing
and meditation can help calm your mind
and reduce overthinking by helping you
focus on the present moment and letting
go of negative thoughts and worries by
incorporating mindfulness techniques
into your daily routine you can start to
reduce overthinking and improve your
energy levels it may take some time to
practice but it can help you feel more
centered and in control if you find this
video relatable and helpful please give
the video a thumbs up and subscribe to
the channel
moving on to the next point not a
mushroom
did you know that not getting enough
sunlight can disrupt your natural sleep
wake cycle and lead to feelings of
tiredness and low energy John M Grove
Hall sidey a clinical psychologist warns
that spending too much time indoors or
in areas with low levels of natural
light can negatively impact your
physical and mental health
and it's important to note that
inadequate exposure to sunlight can even
result in a deficiency of vitamin D
which has been linked to depression and
other mental health issues but don't
worry there are ways to combat these
negative effects you could try using a
light therapy lamp that imitates natural
sunlight these lamps produce bright
light with blue wavelengths that are
similar to the sun's rays which can help
regulate your body's internal clock
interestingly a study conducted in 2016
by measters and colleagues found that
light therapy can even be helpful in
treating sleep disturbances in
Alzheimer's patients so investing in a
light therapy lab could be a smart move
if you're looking for a natural way to
improve your sleep and wake cycle
clutter
have you ever noticed that your
cluttered living or workspace can leave
you feeling overwhelmed and stressed out
Studies have shown that having too much
clutter around can actually affect your
mental health and cognitive functioning
making it harder to focus and be
productive
clutter can also create a sense of
disorganization and Chaos which can
contribute to feelings of stress and
anxiety in fact clutter can be a
physical manifestation of emotional
stress leading to a vicious cycle of
clutter and stress fortunately there are
ways to combat the negative effects of
clutter taking the time to declutter
your space can involve getting rid of
items you no longer need organizing your
belongings and finding new systems to
help you keep your space tidy by doing
so you can create a more calming and
productive environment that helps reduce
stress and boost your energy levels so
why not take a step towards a more
peaceful and organized Life by clearing
out the Clutter today have you noticed
any other factors in your life that
could be zapping your energy and causing
fatigue please feel free to share them
with us in the comments also if you
found this video helpful we'd appreciate
it if you could give it a thumbs up and
share it with anyone else who might find
it useful thank you so much for taking
the time to watch and we look forward to
connecting with you again soon the
references and studies used in this
video are added in the description below

that brings positivity and mental
Wellness to your daily life get your
very own side The Lovable plushie is
here to brighten your days it embodies
the spirit of psych2go and it serves as
a reminder to prioritize your mental
well-being its Green Leaf symbolizes
growth renewal and the importance of

as a thoughtful gift for a loved one Psy
is ready to be your snuggly friend
through all of life's ups and downs by
